bibl.title: Letter from W. E. Deeks to Florence M. Read, December 11, 1923

div1.p: Deeks sends Read several letters regarding a fatal case of malaria on board ship.

div1.head: Letter from W. E. Deeks to Florence M. Read, December 11, 1923
div1.opener:
Answer
COPY
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
Medical Department
17 Battery Place, New York
December 11, 1923.
Miss Florence M. Read,
International Health Board,
Rockefeller Foundation,
New York.
Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
In response to your inquiry of the 7th instant we are
enclosing a copy of a letter addressed by our General Agent to
the American Consul-General in Havana, and the ship doctor's re-
port of death with accompanying statement.

This is all the information in our possession concern-
ing the death of James S. Roudabush. We are writing to our Port
Medical Officer at New Orleans for further details and will be
glad to transmit his reply to you.

Please return the enclosures at your earliest conven-
ience.
